---

::: aside

Lightly adapted from: [NYT Cooking, Zainab Shah](https://cooking.nytimes.com/recipes/1024095-kerala-style-vegetable-korma)

:::

- 1/4 cup coconut oil or vegatable oil
- 1 onion, finely chopped
- 2 tsp black mustard seeds
- 1 tsp grated ginger
- 1 tsp grated garlic
- 3 Thai chiles or 1 jalape√±o sliced
- ground black pepper to taste
- salt to taste
- 1 tsp red chile powder or hot paprika or more to taste
- 1/2 tsp turmeric
- 3 medium tomatoes, chopped
- 2 Tbsp cashew or peanut butter
- 1.5 lbs frozen (not thawed) mixed vegatables (I use "stir fry mix")
- 1 (13.5-ounce) can coconut milk
- 1 teaspoon garam masala or more to taste
- chopped cilantro

---

1. Heat oil in a dutch oven or large pot over medium. When hot, onion and saute
about 5 minutes (browning or not as desired). Add mustard seeds, garlic, 
and ginger, and continue to saute for 1 minute.
2. Stir in spices, tomatoes and cashew butter, continue to cook until the 
tomatoes break down, about 5 minutes. 
3. Add vegatables and coconut milk. Cook for 8-10 minutes.
4. Add garam masala and cilantro. Serve with rice or naan and Indian pickles.
